item.description:
EVENT IS STILL ON

Spend the day at the Cape!

First we’ll go to the Beach in Mashpee.   A great place to be during a heatwave.

Then we’ll head on over to Popponesset for the biggest lobster rolls you have ever seen.   They have lots of other food choices if you want something else. Then, what would the cape be without going out for ice cream or frozen yogurt?

Meet 10 am at the Beach

Park your car, walk up the walkway, and we’ll meet where the walkway meets the beach.

If you come later, call me on my cell which will be given out to those who RSVP.

Some time between 2 and 3 pm we’ll leave the beach and head on over to the Popponesset Market Place to enjoy delicious lobster rolls or whatever else you prefer to eat.  Here we can enjoy the cute shops and galleries as well.

If you have never been to Mashpee Commons you don't want to miss this. Outdoor mall of great shops and this is where we'll top our great day off with a yummy ice cream. 

Daily Itinerary with Approximate Times

  • 10:00 am - 1:00 pm Beach
  • 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm Lobster Rolls
  • 2:30 pm - 3:30 pm Mashpee Commons and Ice Cream

 

Please note that this beach does not have facilities or food. However I do believe there is a porta potty. 
There are lots of places you can stop along the way before getting to the Mashpee Rotary.  Here are a few of them...

  • There is a nice gas station and convenience store around 3 miles down on the right before the lights at Sandwich Road.  This is a Hess with a Dunkin Donuts.
  • Starbucks is in Mashpee Commons 
  • Roche Bros plaza is on the way via South Cape Beach 

Parking at the Beach is $7

If you have a Mass State Park sticker, it is free.

Make sure you go to the State Park Beach and not the Town Beach.   See directions below:

 

From 495 and Route 25 drive over the Bourne Bridge.    Drive approximately ten minutes and take the 151 exit.   Bear right off the exit, drive approx. 6.5 miles til you see a sign on the right that reads: *To Popponesset, South Cape Beach. Follow signs to South Cape Beach. This is Job's Fishing Road.  Take it all the way to end crossing Route 28 and Roche Bros Plaza (South Cape Village). Go right on to Great Neck Road follow signs to South Cape Beach State Park for approximately 6 miles. Entrance is on left.

*If you miss the sign to South Cape Beach off Route 151, go to the rotary and follow these directions: From the East/Mashpee Rotary
From the Mashpee Rotary follow Great Neck Road (south) toward New Seabury. Turn left at the main entrance, marked with a State Park sign.
item.how_to_find_us: Park your car, walk up the walkway, and weâ€™ll meet where the walkway meets the beach.
item.name: Beach Day at the Cape and the Biggest Lobster Rolls You've Ever Seen!
